snippet: Of the 2,076 properties examined in a new survey, 64 percent were appraised at values that exceeded the sale price, while 35.5 percent were appraised at less than the sale price.
abstract: Trepp LLC survey of 2,076 commercial properties from March 2007 through September 2011 finds 64 percent were appraised at values exceeding the sale price, by a total of $1.4 billion while 35.5 percent were appraised at less than the sale price, by a total of $661 million.
lead_paragraph: Of the 2,076 properties examined in a new survey, 64 percent were appraised at values that exceeded the sale price, while 35.5 percent were appraised at less than the sale price.

headline.seo: Appraisals Overvalue Real Estate, Study Finds
headline.main: Accuracy of Appraisals Is Spotty, Study Says
headline.print_headline: Accuracy of Appraisals Is Spotty, Study Says
